intro: Philotheca gardneri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mountain geranium, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in woodland or heathland environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its distinctive scent. Philotheca gardneri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
